Customers have used these fans to cool various home theater components such as tube amps, sound systems, and amplifiers. The versatility of these fans, including their ability to be placed in various locations and the flexibility of rubber feet for push or pull configurations. These fans are commonly used for cooling computer components, including 3D prints and laptops, as well as providing exhaust fans for various setups.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2023
reviews.reviewText: These fans work great at moving heat around from a wood stove. Control works great, very quiet motor. Definitely recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Using this with a mist fogger - working great so far!
reviews.reviewText: I have this set up in front of a mist fogger to circulate the humidity in a grow tent for mycology experiments and growing cactus and vegetables. I have the fan and the fogger connected to an Inkbird humidity controller. Bam. There it is, it completes the system. The noise is barely noticeable outside the tent, but of course if you set it on high speed it makes a bit more noise. But overall I am happy with how quiet it is, and the fan speed controller is fantastic also. I also love that the fan and controller connect with a plug, so if either of them go bad, you can easily replace with no wiring necessary. 2 months so far and still working great. That's what you needed to know, right? Happy growing! Helpful?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Keeps the radio cool
reviews.reviewText: Bought this for a radio base station which has a tendency to run a tad warm on 45 watts output. Added the fan on top and it keeps cool air flowing through the vents of the radio and power supply. It takes a minute or two to add the upper and lower screen and the rubber feet. The speed control is a great addition to both change the speed of the fan up and down which ties into the fans noise. I run the fan at a little less than halfway (low noise) but turn it up for long transmission times (loudest). It appears to work great keeping the radio components cool. It does not move from its position sitting on the rubber feet on top of the radio cabinet. The radio is just beneath the top which is vented. The power supply has its own fan on the bottom of the cabinet. The radio is a Kenwood TK-8360hu-k and the cabinet is a Samlex SEC-1223-TK3 (23 amp) with a Kenwood KMC-35 IP55 microphone. I would buy this again for another radio. Note: on high speed, the fan noise isn't all that loud and it does provide a comfortable cool breeze around the cabinet as well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice little fan
reviews.reviewText: This fan is bigger than I expected, even though I saw the dimensions before ordering. That said, it's working exactly as I hoped it would, cooling some computer equipment that tends to run warm by blowing some air across it. I chose this particular fan because of the controls, which are not part of the brick that plugs into the outlet and are fully adjustable from very low RMP to very high. The fan is quiet, but as you turn it higher (i.e. higher voltage/RPM), the fan does get louder. But that's the nature of the fan. This is basically the same type of fan you'd find in a computer, modified to connect to AC power, with two metal screens and some feet. It’s nothing pretty to look at, but functional. The main reason I'm only rating it 4 stars is that the brief instructions that were included are not relevant to this product, so essentially there are no instructions. It's not that I couldn't figure it out, but I'm an instruction guy and expect something basic.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I ordered this fan system for my internet router which was getting hot. The manufacturer design is passive airflow. By adding this fan to the router it now pulls outside air in and allows better heat exchange. The best part is the speed controller. I have the speed set to cool down the router but not be loud. No more interruptions and buffering issues. Shipping was fast!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great for my diy humidifier
reviews.reviewText: Product as described, working good for my diy humidifier.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for keeping tube radios cooler.
reviews.reviewText: This is exactly what I needed. Plugs in a wall outlet and has a variable speed fan. Can be ultra quiet at very low speed settings. Turned up all the way it can provide a good amount of air flow. The noise level goes up but it isn't overpowering. I set it on top of my (tube) radio and I run it just above the lowest setting. Keeps the radio much cooler. I am very happy with this product. The price was so reasonable I didn't have to take the time to manufacture something myself. When I saw the product I immediately bought two (2) of them. I'm glad I did. If you need a variable speed fan you will be happy with this item.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great adjustable speed.
reviews.reviewText: Really like this fan. The adjustable fan speed works great. We use this to force air through our passive solar heat collector to help heat our basement. Like the fact that it comes with a 1 year replacement warranty.
as described bought this to move air from my propane wall heater and it does the trick just nicely
Been running it to fan those dumb RV spots the condensation collects
